Such "global, one-time, setup / tear-down" is outside the scope of JUnit, a=
ccording to me. You should turn to your test-running tool on this one, i.e.=
 Surefire.

Surefire is your tool to organize which tests to run when and h=
ow. JUnit is glue between Surefire and the JUnit test-classes.

About your =
problem I think you have put yourself in a corner by trying to run all test=
s in parallel in the same JVM. Even if you could use "global, one-time, set=
up / tear-down" you still put very strict limits on what your test-classes =
can safely do and I simply don't think it is worth it.

I strongly advice y=
ou to rethink here and configure Surefire with forkMode=3D"perthread", so t=
hat parallel test-executions take place in separate JVM-processes.

cheers =
/Henrik
